channel.title: physics on stemformulas
channel.description: Recent content in physics on stemformulas

item.title: Maxwell's Equations
item.description: The four Maxwell’s equations describing electromagnetism.

item.title: Newton's Law of Cooling
item.description: Newton’s Law of Cooling.

item.title: Boltzmann Entropy
item.description: The Boltzmann Entropy formula.

item.title: Modulus of Resilience
item.description: The formula for the modulus of resilience.

item.title: Modulus of Rigidity/Shear Modulus
item.description: The modulus of rigidity or shear modulus formula.

item.title: Modulus of Toughness
item.description: The formula for the modulus of toughness.

item.title: Poisson's Ratio
item.description: The Poisson’s Ratio formula.

item.title: Resistance in a straight conductor
item.description: The formula for resistance in a straight conductor.

item.title: Thermal expansion
item.description: The thermal expansion formula.

item.title: Light Wavelength and Frequency Relationship
item.description: The relationship between the wavelength and frequency of light.

item.title: Photon Energy
item.description: The energy of a photon.

item.title: Schrodinger's Equation
item.description: The Schrodinger equation is a partial differential equation that describes the behavior of a quantum system.

item.title: Lorentz Transformations
item.description: Lorentz transformations are used to transform between inertial frames of reference.

item.title: Hooke's Law (Modulus of Elasticity)
item.description: Hooke’s Law and Modulus of Elasticity relate the stress and strain of a material.

item.title: Hooke's Law (Spring Constant)
item.description: Hooke’s Law and the Spring Constant relate the force and displacement of a spring.

item.title: Ampere's Law
item.description: Ampere’s law is a formula that describes the magnetic field produced by a current-carrying wire.

item.title: Gauss's Law
item.description: Gauss’s law is a formula that describes the electric field produced by a charge distribution.

item.title: Gravitational Potential Energy
item.description: The potential energy of an object in a gravitation field.

item.title: Kinetic Energy
item.description: The energy of motion.

item.title: Laplace's Equation
item.description: Laplace’s equation is a common partial differential equation

item.title: Momentum (Newtonian)
item.description: The momentum of a body in Newtonian mechanics

item.title: Newton's 2nd Law
item.description: The law that describes the acceleration of an object in Newtonian mechanics.

item.title: Ohm's Law
item.description: Ohm’s law states that the current through a conductor between two points is directly proportional to the voltage across the two points.
